bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence T. Royster to Emilie Lawrence Reed, November 15, 1930

div1.p: Royster thanks Emilie Lawrence Reed for the copy of Gorgas' book and the letter to Walter Reed. He enjoyed her visit.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence T. Royster to Emilie Lawrence Reed, November 15, 1930

opener.dateline:
BOX ONE FOUR EIGHT
UNIVERSITY, VIRGINIA
Nov. 15. 30

div1.p:
You don't know how much I thank you for
the copy of General Gorga's book. The inscription
& the letter to Dr Reed are very valuable.

We enjoyed hearing from you & Mrs Royster &
Miss Mitchell, both of whom have been laid
up since you were here join me in kindest
regards.

I expect to be in Washington during the coming
week & look forward seeing you both
It is uncertain at the moment about my being
able to accept your kind invitation to a meal
since my advance program calls for a
conference luncheon or dinner, at every meal
during the conference. Mrs Royster will not
be able to attend owing to her indisposition.
We enjoyed having you & Mrs Reed Jr
to our home so much & hope it will
not be the last time.

I shall be at the Hotel Washington,
With kindest regards & sweet affection
Then
